course_title: Studies in African American Literature: 1900 to Present: Passing MiscegenationHybridity
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 12 / Seats Avail: 12Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Same as ENG 359 1, AMST 385 )
Title: Passing Miscegenation Hybridity


An examination of racial passing, "race mixing," and cultural hybridity through 20th-c. African American literature. Explores questions of identity, literary traditions, and the ways racialized performance navigate or destabilize constructions of race, patriarchy, and "the color line" in American society and Western culture. A topics course dealing with major traditions and issues in African American literature from 1900 to the present.
course_description: A topics course dealing with major traditions and issues in African American literature from 1900 to the present. Possible topics include passing and miscegenation, black novels since 1950, Afrofuturism, and black theater.
